original: Exhibit 10.16 MARKETING AFFILIATE AGREEMENT This Agreement is made this 1 st day of October 2008, (the “Effective Date ”), by and between  Equidata, Inc., a corporation organized under the laws of Virginia with its principal place of business at 724 Thimble Shoals  Boulevard Newport News, Virginia 23606 (“Equidata”), and National Credit Report.com, LLC a Corporation  organized under the laws of Florida, with its principal place of business at 7700 N. Congress Ave, Suite  3113, Boca Raton FL33487 ( “Marketing Affiliate ”).
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.16 MODIFIED MARKETING AFFILIATE AGREEMENT

This Agreement is entered into on the 1st day of October 2008, hereinafter referred to as the "Effective Date", by and between National Credit Report.com, LLC, a Florida corporation with its principal place of business at 7700 N. Congress Ave, Suite 3113, Boca Raton FL33487 ("Marketing Affiliate"), and Equidata, Inc., a Virginia corporation with its principal place of business at 724 Thimble Shoals Boulevard, Newport News, Virginia 23606 ("Equidata").

From this point forward, the roles and obligations will be slightly adjusted:

Under the terms of this Agreement, Equidata shall have the primary responsibility for all marketing activities, strategies, and execution. The Marketing Affiliate shall provide its support and cooperation in good faith to facilitate these marketing efforts. Any success or growth achieved from these marketing activities shall primarily benefit Equidata, but the Marketing Affiliate shall be entitled to a fair share of the profits, as outlined in Section 10.5 of this Agreement.

In the event that any claims, disputes, or legal actions arise from this Agreement or its execution, it shall be the responsibility of the Marketing Affiliate to manage and handle these matters with Equidata's full support and cooperation. However, it is understood that the final decision-making power in resolving such disputes lies solely with Equidata.

This modification serves to clarify the division of responsibilities and authority within this Agreement. The core principles and obligations outlined in the original Agreement remain unchanged.

original: 1. Equidata provides certain personal credit, fraud detection, credit scoring services and  credit monitoring for consumers, the (“Services”).
ollama_generated: 1. As a valued service to consumers, Equidata offers select personal credit, fraud detection, credit scoring, and credit monitoring services, hereafter referred to as the "Services." However, it is the sole responsibility of the consumer to verify and confirm the accuracy of any information provided by Equidata and its Services.

original: 1. Compensation.  Marketing Affiliate shall be responsible for collecting all amounts due  directly from the Consumer and shall bear sole responsibility for non -payment of any fees  charged to the Consumer. Marketing Affiliate shall pay to Equidata, as compensation for its  providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in Exhibit  A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi -monthly basis by Equidata and are due  and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date. The prices set  forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or  taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include  additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed  by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA ’s). Said amounts charged to Equidata will be billed  separately to Marketing Affiliate and are due immediately upon  receipt. Marketing Affiliate  agrees to reimburse Equidata all costs of collecting any past due amounts from Marketing  Affiliate by reason of non payment, including reasonable attorney fees and disbursements.
ollama_generated:
1. Compensation: Under this agreement, Equidata shall be responsible for the provision of its Services to Marketing Affiliate. In return, Marketing Affiliate will make payments to Equidata as outlined in Exhibit A attached hereto, which are due 30 days from the invoice date and billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata. It is important to note that Marketing Affiliate shall have the primary responsibility for ensuring prompt payment of fees charged to the Consumer, although Equidata may seek assistance if required.

Any amounts due to Equidata which remain unpaid may result in additional charges or late fees, as determined by Equidata at its discretion. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax, or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities. Additionally, Marketing Affiliate is expected to reimburse Equidata for any costs incurred during the collection of past due amounts, including reasonable attorney fees and disbursements, should it become necessary.

In the event that Marketing Affiliate is unable to fulfill its payment obligations, Equidata reserves the right to temporarily suspend or terminate the Services under this agreement, at its discretion. It is also important to note that Marketing Affiliate shall remain liable for any unpaid amounts due to Equidata and may be subject to additional fees or penalties as a result.

original: Equidata reserves the right to increase the base cost of Services. Notice will be given to  Marketing Affiliate in writing no less than 30 days prior to such increase taking affect. A  development fee, yet To Be Determined and outlined in Exhibit A, is due upon a signed  agreement of project scope.
ollama_generated:
Equidata retains the discretion to adjust downward, if deemed necessary, the base cost of Services. Such adjustment will be communicated to Marketing Affiliate in writing at least 30 days prior to its implementation. It is important to note that a development fee, as yet undetermined and comprehensively detailed in Exhibit A, becomes payable upon the execution of a mutually agreed project scope agreement.

In this version, Equidata has the discretion to lower the base cost rather than increase it, providing more flexibility in terms of pricing adjustments. The responsibility of communicating the change is still on Equidata, as well as the requirement for a development fee upon project agreement signing remains intact.

original: 3. Operational Specifications. Marketing Affiliate and Equidata shall agree upon Operational  Specifications pertaining to the methodology and logistics of data transfer and database  coordination. Upon mutual agreement as to the Operational Specifications, they shall be deemed  to be a part of this Agreement by way of an Exhibit. Both parties must agree upon any changes  to the Operational Specifications in writing. Any such changes will be deemed to be a part of  the Operational Specifications.
ollama_generated: 3. Data Transfer and Database Coordination Protocols: While Equidata and Marketing Affiliate are not strictly bound to any specific methodology or logistics for data transfer and database coordination at the outset, they are encouraged to establish and agree upon such protocols (hereafter referred to as "Operational Specifications"). It is understood that these Operational Specifications, once mutually agreed upon, will constitute an integral part of this Agreement and shall be included in an Exhibit. Any subsequent changes to the Operational Specifications must be made in writing and will likewise become a part of the said protocols. However, it is acknowledged that failure to reach an agreement on these matters may not necessarily result in breach of this Agreement, but rather require further discussions and potential adjustments as circumstances dictate.

original: 5.1. Violates any applicable law or regulation; including but not limited to the sale of  illegal goods or the violation of export control or obscenity laws; that invade the privacy of  any third party; that are in any way connected with the transmission of “junk mail ”, “spam” or the unsolicited mass distribution of e -mail, or with any unethical marketing practices.
ollama_generated:
5.1. The User hereby agrees not to engage in activities that:
   a) Directly or indirectly violate any applicable law, regulation, or code of conduct; this includes but is not limited to dealing in illicit goods, breaching export control or decency regulations, or infringing upon the privacy rights of third parties.
   b) Are associated with transmitting unsolicited emails, spam, or bulk distribution of email, as well as any marketing practices deemed unprofessional or improper by prevailing ethical standards.
   c) The User shall bear full responsibility for ensuring that their actions do not fall under the aforementioned categories and accept all consequences arising from such violations.

original: Such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld and shall  be completed within 48 hours of receipt of Marketing Materials for review.
ollama_generated: Approval, while not automatically granted, will be promptly addressed and a decision communicated within 48 hours following the receipt of Marketing Materials for review, unless extraordinary circumstances prevail requiring an extension. In such instances, the reviewing party shall provide written notice explaining the reasons for the delay, along with a revised timeline for response.

original: 8.1 Marketing Affiliate does  not engage in any business with respect to, and the Marketing  Affiliate Web Site will not be used, or display any materials, in any form or medium,  in connection with a credit clinic, credit repair or restoration, credit counseling firm,  financial counseling firm, detective agency, private investigation, security services, practice  of law, news reporting or journalism, or fraudulent or unethical conduct.
ollama_generated: 8.1 The Marketing Affiliate retains the discretion to engage in any lawful business activities, provided that such activities do not involve the operation of a credit clinic, credit repair or restoration services, financial counseling, detective agency, private investigation, security services, legal practice, news reporting, journalism, or any conduct deemed fraudulent or unethical. The Marketing Affiliate additionally reserves the right to display materials on its website that are not associated with any of the aforementioned activities.
